result.execSummary:
The defendant Zahid Zavala was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. 
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
With credit for 157 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

supervisions.notes: **2/10/2016  Extended Supervision term commuted to two years and six months.

superTimeConds.notes: Court order 25 hours, yearly, of community service at a non-profit organization.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Attempt Robbery with Use of Force

ADDRESS INFO for Zahid Zavala
Current: 3200 W Wisconsin Ave Apt F, Milwaukee, WI 53208 United States  (Effective: 10-20-2017)
Prior: 4667 North 39th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Original Transcript Jury Trial - Testimony, Closings (113 pages) commencing 8-17-15 received and filed.
Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Department of Correction Attn. Records 2909 E Park Ave. Chippewa Falls, WI 54729

PURSUANT to Sec 973.01, WI Stats. ZAHID ZAVALA was sentenced on 10/13/2015 to a bifurcated sentence of 2 YEARS confinement and 2 YEARS, 6 MONTHS extended supervision for a TOTAL SENTENCE OF 4 YEARS, 6 MONTHS.  The defendant was deemed eligible for participation in thee Earned Release Program, in accordance with Sec. 302.05(3)(a)(2), Wisconsin Statues.

PURSUANT to Sec. 302.05(3)(c), WI Stats., within 30 days after the court has been notified that the defendant has successfully completed the Earned Release Program, the court shall modify the bifurcated sentence.  The portion of the Confinement Time not served will be added to the Extended Supervision portion of the sentence.  The total length of the sentence will not change.

Whereas, ZAHID ZAVALA entered and began participation in the Challenge Incarceration Program on 1/25/2016.

Whereas, ZAHID ZAVALA has successfully completed the Challenge Incarceration Program of 6/10/2016.

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by DOC Central Records, and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.  LMS
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 6, Judge Brostrom.  jm

Defendant Zahid Zavala in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Zahid Zavala in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court addressed concerns raised regarding the PSI.

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Beth Ann B.

AMENDED CHARGE:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, with credit for 157 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Court order 25 hours, yearly, of community service at a non-profit organization.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

 Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Zahid Zavala in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Zahid Zavala in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS. 

At the hour of 4:09pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to the lesser included, ATTEMPT ROBBERY-USE OF FORCE, AS PARTY TO A CRIME, which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied Defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

At request of the parties, Court ordered PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zahid Zavala in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Zahid Zavala in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:RoseMarie Galindo-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
